author: costin
msg: If a .h file is modified we'll remove all .o files ( before doing the full
rebuild ). Otherwise we'll do full rebuilds until all .o files are compiled
corectly ( since at least some .o files will be older than .h - triggering
a full rebuild )

author: costin
msg: Blind replace for the new files.

author: costin
msg: Replaced the worker registration ( worker_list.h ), use the new mechanism in
jk_worker.c

author: costin
msg: A small change in the mechanism used to register workers.
Jk is 'object oriented', but so far the only 'interface' with multiple implementations
are 'jk_worker'. ( well, also the server adapter - but at runtime you have a single
one, depending on what server you use ).
In order to 'play' with different channels and optimizations _without_ affecting the
stability of jk we need to enhance the config mechanism to support other object types.
( for example different types of channel ).
This is also a first step in using APR - again, the current code will remain as
the 'stable' implementation ( after some minimal refactoring ), while objects using
APR can be configured-in at runtime ( on Apache2.0 or if apr is available ).
Before this, we had an array of workers that was used to create the worker_list.
This changes add a 'registerFactory' method that could be used for any kind of
object  ( right now we don't check for type, the factory method will be able to do
this ). This is similar with how hooks are registered in 2.0 ( using explicit method
calls )
An additional benefit is that we can split jk in multiple modules - the 'main' module
will contain the common code, and additional modules could plug in alternative
workers, channels, loggers, etc.
The jk_env will grow to provide a simpler access to loggers, pools, etc.
The code change is minimal - and everything seems to work fine, but it would be nice if
someone can verify.

author: costin
msg: On my linux it's called 'config.status', not '-status'.
Needed to compile statically ( needed for prof - I couldn't find any way to do it
on .so )
